alert.note: Alert for Northeast Aroostook; Northern Piscataquis; Northwest Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:23PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Piscataquis and northwestern Aroostook Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 823 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles north of Saint Pamphile to 18 miles northeast of Nine-mile Bridge to near Clayton Lake to 10 miles west of Churchill Dam. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Eagle Lake, Allagash, Clayton Lake, Deboullie Mountain, Russel Crossing, Allagash Township, Big Machias Lake, Fish River Lake, Dickey, Winterville, Saint Francis, Round Pond and Saint John. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for northern and north central Maine.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Aroostook; Northern Piscataquis; Northwest Aroostook
